GetStereoMethod.short_help: Returns the method and options being used for stereo display
GetStereoMethod.description:
method can be 'Quad Buffer', 'Anaglyph', 'Crosseyed', 'Interlaced', 'Checkerboard', 'Left Eye Only' or 'Right'
If method is 'Anaglyph':
	option1 can be 'Red/Cyan', 'Red/Green',	'Red/Blue', 'Amber/Blue' or 'Green/Magenta'
	option2 can be 'Monochrome', 'Half-color',	'Color', 'Optimised' or 'Dubois'

SetStereoMethod.short_help: Sets the method for stereo display
SetStereoMethod.description:
method can be one of the following strings:
	'Quad Buffer'	Enable OpenGL quad-buffered stereo mode
	'Anaglyph'		Tint and combine views for anaglyph glasses
		option1 can be 'Red/Cyan', 'Red/Green',	'Red/Blue', 'Amber/Blue' or 'Green/Magenta'
		option2 can be 'Monochrome', 'Half-color',	'Color', 'Optimised' or 'Dubois' (forces 'Red/Cyan')
	'Crosseyed'		Display views side-by-side for crosseyed viewing
	'Interlaced'		Display views on alternate scanlines
	'Checkerboard'		Stereo support for checkerboard DLPs
		option1 is the value for gamma correction of the polariser screen
	'Left Eye Only'	Display left eye view only
	'Right Eye Only'	Display right eye view only

GetStereoSource.short_help: Returns the source being used for stereo display
GetStereoSource.description:
ABsource is true if the A & B buffers are used for left & right
stacked is true if the two halves of the image are used
stackmethod will be 'Horizontal' or 'Vertical'

SavePrefs.short_help: Saves the current view prefs to a named configuration

IsStereoSwapped.short_help: Indicates if the left & right stereo eyes are currently swapped

IsStereoEnabled.short_help: Indicates if stereo display is currently enabled

GetViewerList.short_help: Returns a list of available viewers

GetSplitTable.short_help: Get the split position of the view as a table
GetSplitTable.description:
Returns:
   x = table[1]
   y = table[2]
   angle = table[3]

SetSplit.short_help: Set the split position of the view

SwapSubView.short_help: Swaps the SubView with the Main View

ShowingSubView.short_help: Returns true if the inset SubView is currently being displayed

ShowingQuadView.short_help: Returns true if the view is split into four

ShowQuadView.short_help: Splits the view into four subviews

GetLocked.short_help: Returns true if the display is locked

SetPos.short_help: Set the position of the display

GetPosTable.short_help: Returns the position of the display as a table
GetPosTable.description:
Returns:
       x = table[1]
       y = table[2]
       z = table[3]

GetPos.short_help: Returns the position of the display

SetRot.short_help: Set the x,y,z rotation of the display in degrees

GetPrefs.short_help: Retrieve a table of preferences for this view
GetPrefs.description: Returns a table of Preference attributes

GetScaleFit.short_help: Indicates if the display is set to scale-to-fit

GetPreview.description:
where 'buffer' is one of the following numbers:
   0 = A
   1 = B
   2 = A|B split
If 'buffer' is not specified, the current Preview is returned.

GetBuffer.description:
where 'buffer' is one of the following numbers:
   0 = A
   1 = B
   2 = A|B split

SetBuffer.description:
where 'buffer' is one of the following numbers:
   0 = A
   1 = B
   2 = A|B split

ShowLUTEditor.short_help: Pops up the Editor window for the current Monitor LUT

GetScale.short_help: Returns the scale of the display

EnableLUT.short_help: Enables or disables the current Monitor LUT

SwapStereo.short_help: Swaps left & right stereo eye views

SetStereoSource.short_help: Sets the source for the left & right stereo images
SetStereoSource.description:
Pass true for ABsource to use the A and B buffers for left & right views.
Pass true for stacked to use the two halves of the image for left & right views.
stackmethod may be 'Horizontal' or 'Vertical' for side-by-side or over-under images, respectively.

SetScale.short_help: Set the scale of the display

GetRotTable.short_help: Returns the x,y,z rotation of the display in degrees as a table
GetRotTable.description:
Returns:
       x = table[1]
       y = table[2]
       z = table[3]

GetSplit.short_help: Get the split position of the view

IsLUTEnabled.short_help: Returns true if the current Monitor LUT is enabled

LoadLUTFile.short_help: Loads a LUT file, setting or LUT plugin ID into the Monitor LUT

LoadPrefs.short_help: Saves the current view prefs to a named configuration

ResetView.short_help: Resets the display to default position etc

GetRot.short_help: Returns the x,y,z rotation of the display in degrees
